instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute Building (2145 Sheridan Road), Room F-119

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the second course in a two-quarter sequence which covers advanced classical mechanics. Topics covered in Physics 330-2 include oscillations, the Lagrangian and Hamiltonian formalisms, kinematics of rigid modes, systems with many degrees of freedom.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisites: PHYSICS 135-1 or the equivalent
MATH 215-0, 217-0, 221-0, or the equivalent

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three one-hour lectures and a one-hour discussion per week

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Homework, one or more mid-terms, and a final examination.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Classical Mechanics, by-John R. Taylor, Publisher-University Science Books. ISBN:978-1891389221
